Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL LOG IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the well log.
Column Comment.2: WELL LOG SOURCE: The source of the well log data.
Column Comment.3: FRAME IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the occurrance of the well log frame.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: the depth at the bottom of the logged interval.
Column Comment.6: DEPTH: the original unit of measure for the interval depths in this table.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: FRAME NAME: The name given to this frame.
Column Comment.10: FRAME SPACING: the spacing of samples within this frame.
Column Comment.13: GAPS IN DATA INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that gaps exist in the data for thisframe.
Column Comment.16: IRREGULAR DESCRIPTION: a short narrative description of the reason the spacingis irregular.
Column Comment.17: IRREGULAR SPACING INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the spacing for thisframe is irregular.
Column Comment.18: LOG DIRECTION: The direction that the tool string was moving when the loggingoccured, usually UP or DOWN.
Column Comment.19: MAX INDEX: the base of the frame; the greatest depth or time or other index value atwhich curve values were captured for this frame.
Column Comment.20: MIN INDEX: the top of the frame; the smallest depth or time or other index value atwhich curve values were captured for this frame.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.22: LOG INDEX TYPE: The type of measurement index for the log, such as depth ortime. The index along which acquisition occurred.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.25: TOP DEPTH: The depth at the top of the logged interval.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
